ai-atk-s0502a18:186_0: ‘There is no true ascetic or brahmin.
ai-atk-s0502a18:189_0: ‘There is no true ascetic or brahmin.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_0: There is nothing lasting harm and suffering in this philosophy.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_1: Sāvatthī does not see any ascetic or brahmin outside the path.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_2: This is the seventh thing that makes known in craving.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_3: Unskilled in being intent on awakening.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_5: And you have nothing called ‘the eternal’.
ai-atk-s0502a18:191_6: For though the Buddhas have allowed the three cravings, the wilderness, the tongue, the body, and the deceived, there’s no need of heartwood.
ai-atk-s0502a18:192_0: Abhadda, Subhadda, the fruit of non-returning, and inspiring.
ai-atk-s0502a18:194_0: The canonical text of the stain of stinginess is finished.
